recipe.title: How to Make Miso Soup
recipe.intro: Miso soup is a traditional Japanese soup. Japanese people drink it every day.
recipe.ingredients: miso paste, tofu, wakame seaweed, dashi stock, green onion, water
steps: **Put** water and dashi stock in a pot and heat it.
**Put** the wakame seaweed in water for five minutes to soften it.
**Add** the tofu and wakame to the pot when the water is hot.
**Turn** off the heat and add the miso paste, then stir well.
**Pour** the soup into bowls and add green onion on top. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I went to Manly Sunset CafÃ© last evening. It was on the hill near Manly Beach. I sat on the terrace and watched the sunset over the ocean. The sky turned pink and lavender. It was so beautiful. I ordered miso soup with a rice set. The soup was warm and made me feel at home. The cafÃ© had wooden tables and soft music. Jasmine flowers were growing near the door. It was my favorite evening in Australia.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Good morning! What are you making?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Good morning! I am making miso soup.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Yes! In Japan, we drink miso soup every morning.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: That is interesting. What is in it?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: No, it is very easy. It takes only ten minutes.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Oh, it is warm and nice. I like it!

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: I am glad! It is good for your health, too.
